intro: Monolena multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered monolena, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes plants such as spiderworts and papyrus. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Monolena multiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wetlands.
